thread.title: Guardians of the Galaxy vol. 2 Super Bowl Trailer Reveals First Look at Taserface
thread.title_full: Guardians of the Galaxy vol. 2 Super Bowl Trailer Reveals First Look at Taserface

author: Kofi Outlaw
title: Guardians of the Galaxy vol. 2 Super Bowl Trailer Reveals First Look at Taserface
text:
Guardians of the Galaxy vol. 2 Super Bowl Trailer Reveals First Look at Taserface Kofi Outlaw Start Photo Gallery Back to Article Image of 
The 2017 Super Bowl trailer for Guardians Of The Galaxy Vol. 2 has just debuted, offering fans of Marvel's team of cosmic oddballs turned heroes a better look at the sequel film! 
As with any new Marvel movie trailer, there were some new character reveals in the Guardians Super Bowl spot: One was the new villain Ayesha (Elizabeth Debicki ) and Taserface , a more obscure Marvel villain being adapted for the Marvel Cinematic Universe in Guardians of the Galaxy vol . 2 . 
Check out the first look at actor Chris Sullivan ( This Is Us ) as Taserface , by viewing the photos in our gallery above! 
Set to the backdrop of ‘Awesome Mixtape #2,’ Marvel’s Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2 continues the team’s adventures as they traverse the outer reaches of the cosmos. The Guardians must fight to keep their new-found family together as they unravel the mysteries of Peter Quill’s true parentage. Old foes become new allies and fan-favorite characters from the classic comics will come to our heroes’ aid as the Marvel cinematic universe continues to expand . 
Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2 is written and directed by James Gunn ( Slither ). The film marks the return of the original Guardians, including Chris Pratt ( Jurassic World ) as Peter Quill/Star-Lord; Zoe Saldana ( Star Trek Into Darkness ) as Gamora; Dave Bautista ( Spectre ) as Drax; Vin Diesel ( Furious 7 ) as the voice of Groot; Bradley Cooper ( American Sniper ) as the voice of Rocket; Michael Rooker ( Jumper ) as Yondu; Karen Gillan ( The Big Short ) as Nebula; and Sean Gunn ( Gilmore Girls ) as Kraglin. New cast members include Pom Klementieff ( Oldboy ), Elizabeth Debicki ( The Great Gatsby, Everest ), Chris Sullivan ( The Knick, The Drop ) and Kurt Russell ( The Hateful Eight, The Thing ).
